systemic_patterns: PhraseOfDay rendering bug: When PhraseOfDay is used, the 'word' prop is not rendered in the HTML output for at least 4 articles (es/spanish-expressing-emotions, it/italian-good-morning-goodnight-phrases, pt/portuguese-meeting-your-partner-s-family, and partially in the es/makeup-phrases article). The word span in content_html is empty even though the MDX source has the word filled in.

Generic 'Viktig frase' placeholder pattern: Two articles (en/video-call, de/long-distance) have large phrase tables where every Norwegian translation column is 'Viktig frase' instead of actual translations. These appear to be from a template generation pass that filled the target-language column but used a placeholder for the native translation.

Template placeholder pattern 'phrase1/phrase2/uttale': Three articles (de/baby-pregnancy, it/honeymoon-travel top section, and seen in wave 2 Polish article) contain literal 'phrase1', 'phrase2' as word values and 'uttale' as pronunciation ‚Äî completely unfilled template stubs.

Raw MDX imports in content: At least 4 articles contain 'import VocabCard from ...' statements at the start of the content field. These are MDX artifacts that should have been stripped during content processing. Some also contain raw <CTA /> tags.

English language names in Norwegian articles: Multiple articles use English language names ('English', 'Spanish', 'German', 'Italian') in table headers and CultureTip titles instead of the Norwegian equivalents ('Engelsk', 'Spansk', 'Tysk', 'Italiensk'). This appears to be a systematic issue with the template system inserting the English language name.

Generic VocabCard examples: Several articles from the 'list-based' generation template use generic filler like 'Bruk denne frasen daglig' or 'En nyttig frase for par' instead of actual example sentences in the target language.

Quality variance by generation method: Articles appear to come from at least 3 different generation pipelines ‚Äî (1) 'template-based' articles with placeholder stubs, (2) 'list-based' articles with real phrases but generic translations/examples, and (3) 'prose-based' articles with full original content. The prose-based articles (en/proposal, fr/anniversary, fr/honeymoon, pt/anniversary, pt/meeting-family) are significantly higher quality.
H1 tags in content_html: Some articles (en/video-call, de/long-distance) have H1 tags in the content body HTML, which would create duplicate headings if the page layout also renders the title as H1.
